solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (24 \times 13 + 13 \times 8 + 24 \times 8) = 1216 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 2.6 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1216 \times 2.6\)
= Rs. 3161.6

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 2.7^2 = 218.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(2.7^2 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 218.7 - 72.9 = 145.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 18 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(145.8 \times 18\)
= Rs. 2624.4

content.text: Kshitij is looking to landscape his garden. He made a diagram of his house (grey colour) but forgot to mention the exact dimensions of the garden area. You are the engineer in charge of the project. Can you use the information given below to calculate the area of the garden? a = 107 m, b = 32 m, c = 42 m, d = 20 m

hint.text: Try subtracting areas to find the right answer

solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = 1848\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{1848}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{1848}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {1848\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 14 cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = 7 cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = 4312 cm^3\)

content.text: A solid cylinder has total surface area of 1848 square centimetres. Its curved surface area is one-third of its total surface area. Find the volume of the cylinder

solution.text:
The volume of the tank \(= 50 cm \times 46 cm \times 48 cm \)= 110400
Rate of flow into the tank = 8L/minute = 8000\(cm^3\)/minute
Therefore, time taken to fill tank completely \(= \frac {110400}{8000} \)= 13.8 minutes

solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= 8624 cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {16}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {16}{2} - 6)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {16}2)^2-\pi (\frac {16}2 - m)^2}\)
= 45.73 cm

Therefore, Number of tiles = 340000

content.text: The area of your school library floor is \(5168 m^2\). You are asked to use tiles in the shape of a parallelogram with a base of 19 cm and a height of 8 cm to cover the floor. How many such tiles will you need to purchase? You can break the tiles in any way to cover the entire floor.

Volume of one brick \(= 20 cm \times 10 cm \times 5 cm = 1000 cm^3\)
\(1 m^3 = 1000000 cm^3\)
Therefore, number of bricks required \(= 28.5 \times \frac{1000000}{1000}\)
\(= 28500\)

solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = 16405.71 \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (16)^2 \times 60 - \pi (16-x)^2 \times 60\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{60\pi}=16^2 - (16-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (16-x)^2 = 256 - \frac{V}{60\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 16 - 13\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

\(= \frac 12 \times 30 \times (25 +\) River Side Length\()\)
Therefore River Side Length = \(\frac{1275}{15} - 25\)
\(= 60 m\)

content.text: Hussain bought a plot of agricultural land which is in the shape of a trapezium (see below). The area of the land is \(1275 m^2\), the side parallel to the road is 25 metres and the width of the field is 30 metres. How long is the side parallel to the river?

hint.text: The area of a trapezium is \(\frac 12 \times Height \times\) (Sum of parallel sides)

solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = 139 \times 33 + \frac 12 \times 48\times(139 + 109)\)
\(= 10539 m^2\)
Rate of flow = 6 km/hr = 6000 m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= 10539 \times 6000 = 63234000 m^3/hr\)
= 63234 megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7\) hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times 63234\)
= 10623312 megalitres

content.text: Your school is building a cylindrical swimming pool with a diameter of 10 metres and a depth of 2 metres. How much water (in litres) will they require to completely fill the pool?

solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = 132 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{132}{\pi} = 42 cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 132 + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 132 + 42\)
= 55.2 \(cm^2\)

content.text: You are given a cylindrical cake with icing on the top and bottom. There is no icing on the curved surface and the curved surface area is \(132 cm^2\). \(= 1572 cm^2\)

solution.text:
Volume of cylinder \(= \pi r^2 \times h = \pi \times 8^2 \times 34 = 6838.86 cm^3\)
Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = 6838.86 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow 28 \times 19 \times h = 6838.86 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {6838.86}{28 \times 19} = 12.85\)
The new cuboid is 12.85 cm tall

content.text: A metal cylinder of height 34 cm and radius 8 cm is melted and reshaped into a cuboid of length 28 cm and breadth 19 cm. No metal was wasted during this process. How tall is the new cuboid?

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 104 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(104 m^2\)
Therefore, \(104 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{104}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 1 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Area of Polygon = Area of Triangle (1) + Area of Trapezium (2) + Area of Triangle (3) + Area of Triangle (4) + Area of Triangle (5)
\(\frac 12 \times a \times b + \frac 12 (b + e)(c + d) + \frac 12 \times e \times f + \frac 12 \times g \times (d+f) + \frac 12 \times (a+c) \times g\)
\(= \frac 12 \times 4 \times 5 + \frac 12 \times 10 \times 7 + \frac 12 \times 5 \times 3 + \frac 12 \times 4 \times 5 + \frac 12 \times 9 \times 4\)
\(=84.5 cm^2\)

solution.text:

= Area of Trapezium \(\times 2\)
\(= \frac 12 (a+c)(h) \times 2\)
\(= \frac 12 (6 + 8)(4) \times 2\)
\(= 56 mm^2\)

solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\pi \times \frac{23}2 \times 4 + 2 \pi \times \frac{6}2 \times 4 + 2\pi({\frac{23}2}^2 - {\frac{6}2}^2)\)
= 1139.29\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= 1139.29 \times 0.2\)
= Rs. 227.86
